p: To combat the overuse of antibiotics, nonantibacterial alternatives should be evaluated in the treatment of AC in female patients. In this case, elimination of bacteriuria may not be suitable as the main objective. Clinical criteria become more important for diagnostics and outcome measures. The ACSS questionnaire, which is validated in several languages, has the potential to be used as a suitable instrument for diagnostics and as a patient-reported outcome measure in well-designed, international, and multilingual clinical studies investigating different treatment modalities of uUTI.
